## Analysis

### Alana's Part

1. How does total outstanding debt and number of debtors change from the financial years 2005-06 to 2021-22? 

2. Which groups are at risk of high debt? 

Loading Data:
```{r}
table_8 <- read.csv("Data/HELP_DATA_TIDIED.csv")
```

Loading Libraries:
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(gridExtra)
library(knitr)
library(bookdown)
library(eeptools)
```

Mean Debtors and Mean Outstanding Debt Summary Tables:

```{r}
str(table_8)

# Group By Year 
table_8_year <- table_8 %>%
  group_by(Year) %>%
  summarise(mean_numDebt = mean(Num_Debtors), 
            mean_outstandingDebt = mean(Outstanding_Debt), 
            total_numDebt = sum(Num_Debtors), 
            total_outstandingDebt = sum(Outstanding_Debt))
  
meanOut_plot <- ggplot(data = table_8_year, aes(x = Year, y = mean_outstandingDebt)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = 0.8) + 
  xlab("Year") + 
  ylab("Mean Outstanding Debt ($)") + 
  labs(title = "Mean Outstanding Debt From 2005-2021", subtitle = "Among All Ages and Sex") +
  theme_minimal() + 
  geom_smooth()


meanDebtors_plot <- ggplot(data = table_8_year, aes(x = Year, y = mean_numDebt)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = 0.8) + 
  xlab("Year") + 
  ylab("Mean Number of Debtors") + 
  labs(title = "Mean Number of Debtors From 2005-2021", subtitle = "Among All Ages and Sex") +
  theme_minimal() +  
  geom_smooth()

totalOut_plot <- ggplot(data = table_8_year, aes(x = Year, y = total_outstandingDebt)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = 0.8) + 
  xlab("Year") + 
  ylab("Total Oustanding Debt ($)") + 
  labs(title = "Total Outstanding Debt From 2005-2021", subtitle = "Among All Ages and Sex") +
  theme_minimal() +  
  geom_smooth()

totalDebtors_plot <- ggplot(data = table_8_year, aes(x = Year, y = total_numDebt)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = 0.8) + 
  xlab("Year") + 
  ylab("Total Number of Debtors") + 
  labs(title = "Total Number of Debtors From 2005-2021", subtitle = "Among All Ages and Sex") +
  theme_minimal() +  
  geom_smooth()

totalDebtors_plot

grid.arrange()

```
